page.title: 01General Survey
page.content: The block covers an area lying to the north of the City of Worcester. Part of the area lies within the City boundary. The majority of the block lies within the ecclesiastical parish of Claines. The origin of the name 'Claines' is thought to have referred to the clay lanes at the junction of which the Parish Church stands. At one time, the ecclesiastical parish emcompassed a large area, right down to The Cross in the centre of Worcester. The land usage is mainly agricultural although there are sizeable areas of quite high density housing, serving the nearby City.
